clusters.title: Queensland records its largest on-shore earthquake in 50 years
clusters.neutral_headline: Queensland Records Largest On-Shore Earthquake in Fifty Years

items.title: Queensland records its largest on-shore earthquake in 50 years
items.standfirst: The epicentre of the quake struck at Kilkivan, west of Gympie and 256 kilometres north of Brisbane, at 9.50am today.
items.content: Queensland has recorded its largest on-shore earthquake in 50 years, measuring a magnitude of 5.6.The epicentre of the quake struck at Kilkivan, west of Gympie and 256 kilometres north of Brisbane, at 9.50am today.It struck at a depth of 10km, according to GeoScience Australia.READ MORE: Police investigate suspicious car fire at Adelaide apartment block Kilkivan business owner Mela Catalla was at work when the earthquake struck."I was just making a coffee and then suddenly felt like 'I don't know what's going on'," Catalla told 9News."I couldn't really comprehend what was going on, then when I found out it was an earthquake, we had to get out."Fellow Kilkivan business owner Gemma Daniels was in her store when the walls started to shake."As soon as everything started crashing together, I just ran out on the road," Daniels said.Luckily nothing was broken when she returned to her store.The earthquake also jolted thousands of kilometres along Australia's east coast.READ MORE: Four arrested after string of robberies in MelbourneThere have been no reports of major damage but some residents have reported cracks in their ceilings. About 13,000 properties and three hospitals across Queensland lost power after sensors automatically shut down parts of the grid."The protection equipment is designed to firstly ensure the safety of the community as well as protect the network and assets from any further damage," Energy Queensland's Anthony Hamill said.More than 12,000 people logged on to the Geoscience Australia website to report which suburbs they felt the earthquake in.The quake was felt as far away as Brisbane, with witness reports saying they felt the shake as far afield as Bundaberg and the Gold Coast.Seismologist Michelle Salmon said the shake was felt from Cairns to Wollongong."This is the largest earthquake we've had on shore in 50 years," Salmon said."We can certainly expect more aftershocks from this event . "An earthquake of this size can cause damage, while we don't measure damage, what you should do is get in touch with the state emergency services if you see any damage at your house."Gympie teenager Jemma Falla told Nine.com.au she was playing guitar on her bed when the items on her desk started rattling."The house started shaking... It felt like the dryer was shaking but a lot more," Falla told Nine.com.au.READ MORE: Experts say the Health Star Rating system has failed. This is why"I've been to the Pacific airshow before, and it was the same shaking as when the jets go over."" It was really strong... it sort of got worse, and then it died down."Falla, who lives in the centre of Gympie, ran outside to the street where other neighbours had gathered." I think everyone was confused... it was just disbelief... when I realised what happened, it was like 'okay I'm not crazy, we just had an earthquake.'""It was so random cause nothing happens in Gympie. My friend's mum was saying this is going to be the most interesting thing that's happened to Gympie."Over 250km away, Upper Caboolture local Jessica Ward was watching TV with her fiance when their house started shaking at the exact same moment. "All of a sudden, the entire house started shaking, the windows were rattling, I heard the washing machine moving around," she said."We looked at each other like, was that an earthquake?"It was really intense for a couple of seconds, and then it died down a bit."She said her father also felt the quake in Deception Bay, and her partner's parents felt it from Redcliff.Ward said it was the first earthquake she had ever experienced. " I'm 26 years old, I've never heard of a quake in Brisbane."Felt reports have even crossed the border into northern New South Wales, with people in the town of Lismore reportedly feeling it.About 13,000 homes are without power around Cherbourg and Burrum Heads, Ergon Energy reports. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Queensland experienced a magnitude 5.6 earthquake.
• The earthquake was the largest on-shore quake in fifty years.

• The quake struck at Kilkivan, 256 kilometers north of Brisbane.
• The earthquake occurred at 9:50 AM today.

clusters.title: Protesters clash with police in Melbourne CBD
clusters.neutral_headline: Protesters and Police Clash in Melbourne CBD

items.title: Protesters clash with police in Melbourne CBD
items.standfirst: Four people have been arrested after protesters clashed with police in Melbourne.
items.content: Four people were arrested after trans rights protesters clashed with police in Melbourne this morning.About 100 people gathered to counter protest a women's rights rally where attendees opposed new hate speech laws in the CBD this morning.The legislation, which will come into effect next month, will carry up to five years jail time for those found to have vilified LGBTQIA+ people and people living with disabilities.READ MORE: Four arrested after string of robberies in Melbourne D ozens of police swarmed the CBD and used water-filled barriers to keep the two protest groups apart after clashes back in April.After leaving the cordon and marching through the streets, a number of trans right protesters were arrested and held on the ground during a clash with officers.Police fired pepper spray and a flare was launched into the air. After moving in a loop back towards Parliament House, splinter groups turned on the media.The protesters and police dispersed after a few hours. Victoria Police said three of its officers were injured today but did not require hospital treatment. Out of the four arrested, a 21-year-old has been accused of assaulting a police officer with an umbrella, while two others were accused of having flares on the streets.Police also told 50 people to remove their face coverings during the protest.While the Victorian government has said it would outlaw people wearing face coverings during protests, the rule has not come in legislation. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. clusters.title: Residents of historic village refuse to pay rent for crumbling homes
clusters.neutral_headline: Cummeragunja residents protest poor housing conditions

items.title: Residents of historic village refuse to pay rent for crumbling homes
items.standfirst: In Cummeragunja, families live in decaying homes while children play on broken equipment. Frustrated by years of inaction, residents and elders are demanding repairs, accountability and recognition for a community deeply tied to Aboriginal history and identity.
items.content: In Cummeragunja, families live in decaying homes while children play on broken equipment. Frustrated by years of inaction, residents and elders are demanding repairs, accountability and recognition for a community deeply tied to Aboriginal history and identity.

• Children play on broken equipment in the historic village.
• Residents and elders demand repairs and accountability for the homes.
• They seek recognition for their community's deep ties to Aboriginal history.
• Years of inaction have led to frustration among the residents.
